name: Moonstone Sleet
descr: [Moonstone Sleet](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1036) is a North Korean-linked threat actor executing both financially motivated attacks and espionage operations. The group previously overlapped significantly with another North Korean-linked entity, [Lazarus Group](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0032), but has differentiated its tradecraft since 2023. [Moonstone Sleet](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1036) is notable for creating fake companies and personas to interact with victim entities, as well as developing unique malware such as a variant delivered via a fully functioning game.(Citation: Microsoft Moonstone Sleet 2024)

subtechniques.name: Domains
subtechniques.descr: [Moonstone Sleet](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1036) registered domains to develop effective personas for fake companies used in phishing activity.(Citation: Microsoft Moonstone Sleet 2024)

subtechniques.name: Virtual Private Server
subtechniques.descr: [Moonstone Sleet](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1036) registered virtual private servers to host payloads for download.(Citation: Microsoft Moonstone Sleet 2024)

subtechniques.name: Web Protocols
subtechniques.descr: [Moonstone Sleet](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1036) used curl to connect to adversary-controlled infrastructure and retrieve additional payloads.(Citation: Microsoft Moonstone Sleet 2024)

subtechniques.name: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder
subtechniques.descr: [Moonstone Sleet](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1036) used registry run keys for process execution during initial victim infection.(Citation: Microsoft Moonstone Sleet 2024)

technique_table_data.name: Browser Information Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [Moonstone Sleet](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1036) deployed malware such as YouieLoader capable of capturing victim system browser information.(Citation: Microsoft Moonstone Sleet 2024)

technique_table_data.name: Data Encrypted for Impact
technique_table_data.descr: [Moonstone Sleet](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1036) has deployed ransomware in victim environments.(Citation: Microsoft Moonstone Sleet 2024)

technique_table_data.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
technique_table_data.descr: [Moonstone Sleet](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1036) delivered payloads using multiple rounds of obfuscation and encoding to evade defenses and analysis.(Citation: Microsoft Moonstone Sleet 2024)

technique_table_data.name: Develop Capabilities

subtechniques.name: Malware
subtechniques.descr: [Moonstone Sleet](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1036) has developed custom malware, including a malware delivery mechanism masquerading as a legitimate game.(Citation: Microsoft Moonstone Sleet 2024)

technique_table_data.descr: [Moonstone Sleet](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1036) developed malicious npm packages for delivery to or retrieval by victims.(Citation: Microsoft Moonstone Sleet 2024)

subtechniques.name: Social Media Accounts
subtechniques.descr: [Moonstone Sleet](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1036) has created social media accounts to interact with victims.(Citation: Microsoft Moonstone Sleet 2024)

subtechniques.name: Email Accounts
subtechniques.descr: [Moonstone Sleet](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1036) has created email accounts to interact with victims, including for phishing purposes.(Citation: Microsoft Moonstone Sleet 2024)

subtechniques.name: Email Addresses
subtechniques.descr: [Moonstone Sleet](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1036) gathered victim email address information for follow-on phishing activity.(Citation: Microsoft Moonstone Sleet 2024)

technique_table_data.name: Gather Victim Org Information
technique_table_data.descr: [Moonstone Sleet](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1036) has gathered information on victim organizations through email and social media interaction.(Citation: Microsoft Moonstone Sleet 2024)

technique_table_data.name: Ingress Tool Transfer
technique_table_data.descr: [Moonstone Sleet](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1036) retrieved a final stage payload from command and control infrastructure during initial installation on victim systems.(Citation: Microsoft Moonstone Sleet 2024)

technique_table_data.name: Obfuscated Files or Information
technique_table_data.descr: [Moonstone Sleet](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1036) delivers encrypted payloads in pieces that are then combined together to form a new portable executable (PE) file during installation.(Citation: Microsoft Moonstone Sleet 2024)

subtechniques.name: Embedded Payloads
subtechniques.descr: [Moonstone Sleet](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1036) embedded payloads in trojanized software for follow-on execution.(Citation: Microsoft Moonstone Sleet 2024)

subtechniques.name: Encrypted/Encoded File
subtechniques.descr: [Moonstone Sleet](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1036) has used encrypted payloads within files for follow-on execution and defense evasion.(Citation: Microsoft Moonstone Sleet 2024)

subtechniques.name: LSASS Memory
subtechniques.descr: [Moonstone Sleet](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1036) retrieved credentials from LSASS memory.(Citation: Microsoft Moonstone Sleet 2024)

subtechniques.name: Spearphishing Attachment
subtechniques.descr: [Moonstone Sleet](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1036) delivered various payloads to victims as spearphishing attachments.(Citation: Microsoft Moonstone Sleet 2024)

subtechniques.name: Spearphishing via Service
subtechniques.descr: [Moonstone Sleet](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1036) has used social media services to spear phish victims to deliver trojainized software.(Citation: Microsoft Moonstone Sleet 2024)

technique_table_data.name: Phishing for Information

subtechniques.name: Spearphishing Link
subtechniques.descr: [Moonstone Sleet](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1036) used spearphishing messages containing items such as tracking pixels to determine if users interacted with malicious messages.(Citation: Microsoft Moonstone Sleet 2024)

technique_table_data.descr: [Moonstone Sleet](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1036) has interacted with victims to gather information via email.(Citation: Microsoft Moonstone Sleet 2024)

subtechniques.name: Scheduled Task
subtechniques.descr: [Moonstone Sleet](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1036) used scheduled tasks for program execution during initial access to victim machines.(Citation: Microsoft Moonstone Sleet 2024)

subtechniques.name: Upload Malware
subtechniques.descr: [Moonstone Sleet](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1036) staged malicious capabilities online for follow-on download by victims or malware.(Citation: Microsoft Moonstone Sleet 2024)

subtechniques.name: Compromise Software Supply Chain
subtechniques.descr: [Moonstone Sleet](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1036) has distributed a trojanized version of PuTTY software for initial access to victims.(Citation: Microsoft Moonstone Sleet 2024)

technique_table_data.name: System Information Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [Moonstone Sleet](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1036) has gathered information on victim systems.(Citation: Microsoft Moonstone Sleet 2024)

technique_table_data.name: System Network Configuration Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [Moonstone Sleet](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1036) has gathered information on victim network configuration.(Citation: Microsoft Moonstone Sleet 2024)

technique_table_data.name: System Owner/User Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [Moonstone Sleet](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1036) deployed various malware such as YouieLoader that can perform system user discovery actions.(Citation: Microsoft Moonstone Sleet 2024)

subtechniques.name: Service Execution
subtechniques.descr: [Moonstone Sleet](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1036) used intermediate loader malware such as YouieLoader and SplitLoader that create malicious services.(Citation: Microsoft Moonstone Sleet 2024)

subtechniques.name: Malicious File
subtechniques.descr: [Moonstone Sleet](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1036) relied on users interacting with malicious files, such as a trojanized PuTTY installer, for initial execution.(Citation: Microsoft Moonstone Sleet 2024)

Microsoft Moonstone Sleet 2024.description: Microsoft Threat Intelligence. (2024, May 28). Moonstone Sleet emerges as new North Korean threat actor with new bag of tricks. Retrieved August 26, 2024.
